meanings.definition: The act of setting a pace or standard for others to follow.
meanings.sent1: Her pacemakings in the race inspired everyone to run faster.
meanings.sent2: The coach's pacemakings motivated the team to work harder.
meanings.sent3: His pacemakings in the dance-off made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: She became the pacemakings of the group, guiding them through challenges.
meanings.sent5: The pacemakings of the choir conductor made the performance flawless.

meanings.definition: The process of establishing peace or harmony.
meanings.sent1: The pacemakings of the negotiation led to a peaceful resolution.
meanings.sent2: After the conflict, the community worked on pacemakings to restore unity.
meanings.sent3: Their pacemakings in the argument diffused the tension instantly.
meanings.sent4: The pacemakings of the mediator brought calm to the situation.
meanings.sent5: The pacemakings of the peacemaker were felt throughout the room.

meanings.definition: The action of regulating or controlling the speed or timing of something.
meanings.sent1: The pacemakings of the metronome kept the musicians in sync.
meanings.sent2: His pacemakings of the traffic flow prevented accidents.
meanings.sent3: The pacemakings of the clock made everyone rush to finish on time.
meanings.sent4: The pacemakings of the stopwatch determined the winner of the race.
meanings.sent5: Her pacemakings of the assembly line improved efficiency.
